acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on Rabbit LD0:ca.9400mg/kg (IUCLID (2000)), it was set as the outside of Category.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Based on description that toxicity did not discover (IUCLID, 2000) by 1-hour exposure of 200 mg/L (4 hour exposure equivalent: 50mg/L) in rats, it was set as the outside of category.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale:
SPECIES: Rat
ENDPOINT: LD50
VALUE: 5000 mg/kg
REFERENCE SOURCE: ACGIH (7th, 2001)

carcinogenicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Liquid at a test temperature, 55degC. Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available.

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_solids.rationale: No data available by regulated examination methods, though "Flammable"

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Since it was negative in the micronucleus test which used the rat myeloid cells by in vivo (NTP DB (2005)), it carried out the outside of Category.

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Containing no oxygen , chlorine and fluorine.

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: We found the description that it had no irritational property in the eye irritation tests using the rabbits (the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development study guideline 405 etc.(IUCLID (2000)). However, based on the description that it had the irritational property on the human eyes, or it caused the inflammation of the cornea (ICSC (J) and ACGIH (7th, 2001)). So we judged that it had a slight ocular irritational property and we catogorized it as Category 2B.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: In the skin irritation test using a rabbit and guinea pig, it was described that there was no stimulativeness in practice (IUCLID, 2000), in that using humans, however, it was described that there was the skin irritation accompanied by redness and pain by occupational exposure (ACGIH, 7th, 2001), JCSC(J)(1998)), so it was set as Category 2.

skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
skin_sensitizer.rationale: We classified it to be Category 1 based on the description that repeated or prolonged skin contact leads to skin sensitization and consequently photosensitivity is induced in ACGIH (7th, 2001) and JCSC(J) (1998).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: HSFS (2001) had description of the disorder to liver, blood (anemia), and the nervous system in human, but, the concrete case report etc. was not shown, and we had the description that toxicity did not occur in the dose which exceeds the guidance value range of Category 2 in the repeated oral administrations in the rat (IUCLID (2000)), we presupposed that we could not categorize it, for the insufficiency of data.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification:
Category 1 (liver, kidney, blood, nervous system, circulatory system),
Category 3 (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement:
Causes damage to organs (liver, kidney, blood, nervous system, circulatory system)
May cause respiratory irritation (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Since there was description in ACGIH (7th, 2001) that obstacle of liver and kidney, hemolytic anemia, an abdominal cramp , and tachycardia are caused by acute exposure. And description also in SITTIG (2002) that there are influences on liver damages, hemolytic anemia, and athletic ability, arrhythmia and kidney disorders, and liver, kidney, blood, the nervous system, and the circulatory organ system were judged as target organs, and all were set as Category 1. Moreover, there is description in  ICSC (J)(1998) that a respiratory tracts is stimulated, and it was set as Category 3 (respiratory irritant).
